meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a follicle.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the follicular cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Her skin had a healthy, follicular appearance.
meanings.sent3: The follicular shampoo promised to make hair shiny and strong.
meanings.sent4: The follicular growth in the garden was a sign of spring.
meanings.sent5: The follicular pattern on the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a follicle or follicles.
meanings.sent1: The follicular glands produce oil to keep the skin moisturized.
meanings.sent2: The follicular structure of the plant helped it absorb nutrients efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The follicular treatment for plants made them grow faster than usual.
meanings.sent4: The follicular roots of the tree spread far and wide in search of water.
meanings.sent5: The follicular openings on the skin can sometimes get clogged with dirt.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or constituting a follicle.
meanings.sent1: The follicular tissue surrounded the developing egg in the ovary.
meanings.sent2: The follicular fluid provides nourishment to the growing hair.
meanings.sent3: The follicular barrier protected the delicate structure inside.
meanings.sent4: The follicular layer of the skin acts as a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The follicular sac holds the potential for new life to begin.
